Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: bbox
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: An H3 hexagon vertices coordinates of the turbulence tile area.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: vertices
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: An H3 hexagon vertices coordinates of the turbulence tile area.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: tile
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: A tile represantation for which the turbulence is tracked.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: alt
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: An altitude based on SkyPath tile altitude, where 1 is 1000 feet. If tile.alt is 38, then alt is 38,000..<39,000 feet. Measured in feet.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: ts
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: A UNIX timestamp of when the report has been generated.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: trend
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: A turbulence severity trend if available and based on the previous data cached.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: distanceTo
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: Distance from current location to a nearest coordinate of vertices. The system provided location is used. When location is not available it will return nil.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: timeTo
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: Time to pass distanceTo based on the current speed. The system provided speed is used. If system speed is invalid or not available the calculated speed based on coordinates change over time will be used.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: timeToPass
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: Time to pass the diameter of the vertices based on the current speed. The system provided speed is used. If system speed is invalid or not available the calculated speed based on coordinates change over time will be used.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.name: alt
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.abstract: A SkyPath tile altitude, where 1 is 1000 feet, so if alt is 38 it stands for 38,000..<39,000 feet.

Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.name: fnum
Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.abstract: Flight number. A combination of the airline’s ICAO code and 1-4 digit number. When there is no such number, use ORIG-DEST-GUID, where ORIG is the ICAO code of the departure airport, DEST is the ICAO code of the destination airport and GUID is a globally unique identifier.

Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.name: fnumManual
Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.abstract: Set true if fnum is an internal flight id and can’t be visible publicly. Set false or nil otherwise. Default is true.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: types
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: What data to fetch from the server. Default is turbulence only.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: sevs
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: Severity levels of turbulence. Will fetch only turbulence with these severities if set. Default is all.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: polygon
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: Polygon coordinates to get turbulence inside it. Should have max 250 coordinates, otherwise SkyPath.didFailToFetchNewData will be called with an error. Simplify polygon with enough tolerance.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: viewport
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: Visible polygon coordinates to get turbulence inside it. Should have max 250 coordinates, otherwise SkyPath.didFailToFetchNewData will be called with an error. Simplify polygon with enough tolerance.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: globalEnabled
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: Wheather to receive global data like turbulence polygons, global traffic and pireps. When false and the polygon is not nill the data inside polygon will be fetched only. Default is true.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: globalTurbulencePolygonsUpToEnabled
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: DataTypeOptions.turbulencePolygons are generated for specific history time set inSkyPath.dataHistoryTime.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: altRange
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: Used only for data that can’t be filtered by altitude locally and need to make a server request. For example, turbulence polygons GeoJSON. In thousands of feet. Max range is 0…50. Optional.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: minSev
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Min severity level of turbulence to alert. Default is light.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: sevs
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Severity levels of turbulence. Will use only turbulence with these severities if set. Optional. Default is nil.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: distance
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Distance of “beam” or route if set. Measured in nautical miles (NM). Default is 100 NM.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: timeFrame
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Time frame from now in which search for turbulence. distance will be ignored. Distance will be dynamically calculated from current speed and this time set. If speed is not currently available, the distance will be used. Measured in seconds. Optional. Default is nil.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: angleSpan
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Angle in degrees from velocity vector. Default is 15 degrees.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: altRange
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Altitude lower and upper bounds of range. Should be round to thousand feet. If set, the turbulence will be searched inside this altitude range only despite the current location altitude. Measured in feet.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: switchToBeamOnDistanceFromRoute
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: If a/c is more than this value from the nearest coordinate of a route (if set), then switch to beam mode searching alerts. Default is 20 NM. Measured in nautical miles (NM).

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: excludeOwnTimeSpan
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Do not alert on own recorded turbulence for last time span. Measured in minutes. Default is 60.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: route
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Route line coordinates to search for alerts.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: widthAround
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Distance from the route line coordinates to search for alerts. Measured in NM. Default is 20 NM.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: polygon
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Polygon coordinates to get turbulence alerts inside it only. Last coordinate should be same as first to have a closed polygon.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: dataHistoryTime
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: History time of queried data. When it’s nil the SkyPath.dataHistoryTime value is used. Optional. Default is nil.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: type
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Type of turbulence data - from server or own local. Default is server.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: altRange
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Altitude lower and upper bounds of range. Should be round to thousand feet. Default is all. Measured in feet.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: resultOptions
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Wheather to receive only as model items or as GeoJSON only, or receive both items and a GeoJSON. Default is GeoJSON.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: aggregate
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Aggregate turbulence by tile, so have only one most severe turbulence per tile. Default is true.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: tiles
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Array of a tile id as (x,y) or as H3 hex when used. Use it to query turbulence in specific tiles.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: dataHistoryTime
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: History time of queried data. When it’s nil the SkyPath.dataHistoryTime value is used. Optional. Default is nil.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.name: altRange
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.abstract: Altitude lower and upper bounds of range. Should be round to thousand feet. Default is 0…52000. Measured in feet.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.name: resultOptions
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.abstract: GeoJSON is supported only. Default is GeoJSON.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.name: dataHistoryTime
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.abstract: History time of queried data. When it’s nil the SkyPath.dataHistoryTime value is used. Optional. Default is nil.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html.name: TurbulencePolygonsQuery
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html.abstract: Control how to query turbulence polygons data.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions..name: TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions..abstract: Control how to receive a queried turbulence polygons result.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResult.html.name: TurbulencePolygonsResult
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResult.html.abstract: Receive queried turbulence polygons data by specifying TurbulencePolygonsQuery.resultOptions.

Structs/TurbulenceResultOptions.html.name: TurbulenceResultOptions
Structs/TurbulenceResultOptions.html.abstract: Control how to receive a queried turbulence result.

Structs/AlertQuery.html.name: AlertQuery
Structs/AlertQuery.html.abstract: Control how to search alerts. By default it uses current location and beam mode with default values.

Structs/Flight.html.name: Flight
Structs/Flight.html.abstract: Flight info to be associated with reports and events.

Structs/Tile.html.name: Tile
Structs/Tile.html.abstract: SkyPath map tile that uses H3 indexing system.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didUpdateRecordingStatus(to:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When successfully started recording the flag will be true.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveNewTurbulenceData()
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When a new turbulence data has been received from the server.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: detectedTurbulence(_:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When a new turbulence event detected or when a tile is declared as “turbulence clean”.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveNewTurbulencePolygons()
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When a new turbulence polygons GeoJSON has been received from the server.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didFailToFetchNewData(with:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: SDK failed to get a new data. Could be due to no connection, server not reachable or any other.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveAlert(_:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Notify when found a new alert when in auto monitoring mode started by startMonitoringAlerts(with:).

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: locationManagerDidFail(withError:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Location manager did fail to get a location.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: serverReachabilityUpdated(to:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When the SkyPath server became reachable or unreachable probably to no internet connection.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didChangeDevicePosition(_:horizontal:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Device should be steady to record turbulence. SDK will auto set new angle after some time of steady position and call this delegate method when needed. While device is not in position, turbulence will not be recorded.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didUpdateLowPowerMode(_:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Device motion and best accuracy location updates can be stopped when not needed to save battery.

Protocols.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK7SPErrorP.name: SPError
Protocols.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK7SPErrorP.abstract: A base error protocol for SDK generated errors.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html.name: SkyPathDelegate
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html.abstract: Delegate methods to receive events form the SDK.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.name: geoJSON(withType:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.abstract: Converts array of TurbulenceItem to a valid GeoJSON that can be visualized on the map. Use it when you have a custom filtering of TurbulenceItem but need a GeoJSON for the map.

Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.name: borderColor
Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.abstract: At the moment only none level has a border color because of white color.

Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.name: colorOpacity
Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.abstract: The default opacity color for the level.

Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.name: colorWithOpacity
Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.abstract: Get a default color with default opacity.

Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.name: userIdOrAirlineInvalid
Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.abstract: User id or airline id is empty or invalid.

Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.name: userLocked(message:)
Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.abstract: User is locked for some time due to many failed authentication attempts.

Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.name: altRangeNotRoundToThousandFeet
Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.abstract: Altitude range should be rounded to thousand feet. For example, 38000-40000 feet is correct, 38000-40100 or 38100-40000 are wrong.

Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.name: polygonTooManyCoordinates
Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.abstract: GeoJSON polygon has too many coordinates. Max is 250. Simplify polygon with enough tolerance.

Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.name: dataQueryInvalid(message:)
Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.abstract: When SkyPath.dataQuery is not configured properly. Check message for more details.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: tooManyRequests
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: When trying to call same endpoint too many times and requests are restricted for some time.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: upgradeRequired(message:)
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: SDK version is not supported, upgrade is required.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: noLocation
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: No location access, for example when no location permission has been granted.

Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.name: invalidCoordinates
Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.abstract: Passed coordinates array is invalid, should contain 2 or more items.

Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.name: invalidPolygon
Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.abstract: Passed polygon array is invalid, should contain 3 or more items.

Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.name: altRangeNotRoundToThousandFeet
Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.abstract: Altitude range should be rounded to thousand feet. For example, 38000-40000 feet is correct, 38000-40100 or 38100-40000 are wrong.

Enums/DataHistoryTime.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: init(mins:)
Enums/DataHistoryTime.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: Create from mins. If wrong mins number default twoHours will be used.

Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.name: server
Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.abstract: Turbulence from the server, aggregated based on multiple reports and per current airplane type.

Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.name: serverExcludeOwn(timeSpan:)
Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.abstract: Use it if you show own and server tiles differently. This will return server turbulence without turbulence for own tiles that a/c has passed for last timeSpan. Turbulence for tiles that has been passed more than timeSpan from now will be included in the result.

Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html.name: TurbulenceResultType
Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html.abstract: SDK stores own tracked turbulence for some time locally on device and also receives turbulence from the server reported by other devices. Use it in TurbulenceQuery.

Enums/AlertResultType.html.name: AlertResultType
Enums/AlertResultType.html.abstract: Type of alerts search: along route coordinates or in a beam mode.

Enums/DataHistoryTime.html.name: DataHistoryTime
Enums/DataHistoryTime.html.abstract: On start SDK receives an initial history data and then periodically receives only updates since the last update. Server does some data precalculations so only the specified time frames are supported. Measured in hours.

Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html.name: DataUpdateFrequency
Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html.abstract: Determines the time interval to fetch data from the server. If for example network traffic should be kept to minimal and it’s ok to receive data more rarely set minimal. The fast will try to update data as soon as possible. When you would like to stop receiving data (for example when SkyPath layer is hidden in the app) set it to none.

Enums/Environment.html.name: Environment
Enums/Environment.html.abstract: Server environment used by SDK internal API routing. serverUrl is a base URL to access SkyPath service, if you don’t need a proxy server pass nil to use default.

Enums/QueryError.html.name: QueryError
Enums/QueryError.html.abstract: Errors returned when making a data query.

Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html.name: TurbulenceTrend
Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html.abstract: Determined when a new data is received by comparing to the previous data.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: shared
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: The shared singleton object that should be used for all operations.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: delegate
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Delegate object to receive events form the SDK.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: start(apiKey:airline:userId:env:completion:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Start SDK. It will not track and provide data until started. Should be called when SkyPath service needs to start (for example on app start) only once until app is relaunched or after it was explicitly stopped by SkyPath.stop().

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: stop()
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Stops all SDK activities including communication with the server and turbulence detection. Cached data is deleted.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataQuery
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Set fetch data query. See DataQuery for more details. All parameters have default values, so by default it’s DataQuery(). You can set a new DataQuery or change any of properties at any time.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataUpdateFrequency
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Configure the frequency of data update from the server. For example, to save network traffic, you can set it to none to disable periodic new data fetch from the server at all, or set to minimal to update with bigger time intervals.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataHistoryTime
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Set history time to receive data for in an initial data request made on start.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataUpdatedAt
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Last date when successfully received new data from the server.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: fetchData(refresh:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: In case you need to get new data immediately (for example when opened the app) call this method and the result will be notified in corresponding delegate methods.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: turbulence(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get turbulence data using a query in local cached data without a making a server request.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: turbulencePolygons(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get turbulence polygons data using a query in local cached data without a making a server request.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: turbulencePolygons
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Turbulence polygons GeoJSON string if available.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: alerts(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get turbulence alerts with a query in local cached data without a making a server request.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: startMonitoringAlerts(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Start monitoring alerts with a query in an automatic mode. Alerts will be searched on location updates. Alerts will be notified via a delegate method newAlert(_:).

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: stopMonitoringAlerts()
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Stop monitoring alerts in an automatic mode.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: isMonitoringAlerts
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Check if auto monitoring has been started or wheather it’s stopped or not started at all.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: aircraft
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Current aircraft. Set it to receive data adjusted for specific aircraft. Should not be nil. When it is not set the turbulence data will not be fetched from the server. This is because the severity level can be different for different a/c types (sizes).

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: aircrafts()
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get all supported by SkyPath aircrafts.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: aircraft(byId:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get an Aircraft by ID.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: startFlight(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Starts a new flight. Flight is saved even across app launches, so startFlight can be called only on a new flight start and stopFlight can be called when flight is ended / removed.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: endFlight()
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Stops the current flight if any was started by startFlight(_:) or setFlight(_:). Flight is saved even across app launches, so startFlight can be called only on a new flight start and stopFlight can be called when flight is ended / removed.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: flight
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Current flight if any set by startFlight(_:).

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: allowsBackgroundLocationUpdates
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Background location access is required to track turbulence and show notifications.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: version
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: SDK version.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: inPosition
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: If device is in position.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: isHorizontal
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: If device is horizontal. Data is not tracked when device is horizontal.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: inNoise
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: If there is a noise currently like moving device out of the position.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: enableSimulation(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: In simulation mode you can pass simulated location to the SDK via simulateLocation(:) for testing purposes only.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: simulatedLocation(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Provide a simulated location for testing only. Should be set to simulation mode by enableSimulation(:).

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: enablePushSimulated(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: The data tracked in simulation mode will not be sent to the server. You can use it during simulation testing.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: simulateTurbulence(sev:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Simulate a turbulence event for testing.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: logger
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Logger that logs network, errors, warnings and other info that can be used to debug.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.name: maxDistanceNM
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.abstract: When distance from turbulence to any turbulence in an existing cluster is greater it will be moved to another or a new cluster.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.name: maxDistanceToNearestNM
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.abstract: When distance from turbulence to the nearest turbulence in an existing cluster is greater it will be moved to another or a new cluster.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.name: process(turbulence:)
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.abstract: Update clusters using turbulence. clusters array will be updated in the following way:

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.name: isAlerted(cluster:)
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.abstract: Checks if the cluster has turbulence tlies that was already alerted (based on tiles) to not alert again.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.name: alerted(cluster:)
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.abstract: Save cluster turbulence as alerted to check by isAlerted(cluster:) to not alert same turbulence multiple times.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.name: reset()
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.abstract: Removes generated and alerted clusters. Should be called when stopped monitoring alerts or stopped the route, or when not need to clustering any more.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: center
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The calculated center of the cluster based on all turbulence coordinates in it.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: severity
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The highest turbulence severity that this cluster has.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: diameterDistance
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The diameter of the cluster based on turbulence coordinates in it.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: distanceTo
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Distance from current location to a nearest coordinate of bbox of turbulence items. The system provided location is used. When location is not available it will return nil.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: timeTo
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Time to pass distanceTo based on the current speed. The system provided speed is used. If system speed is invalid or not available the calculated speed based on coordinates change over time will be used.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: timeToPass
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Time to pass diameterDistance based on the current speed. The system provided speed is used. If system speed is invalid or not available the calculated speed based on coordinates change over time will be used.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: nearestMaxSevTurbulence
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The nearest turbulence item from turbulence based on the tile center. The system provided location is used. When location is not available it will return nil.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: nearestMaxSevCenter
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The center of the nearest turbulence tile with the highest severity. The system provided location is used. When location is not available it will return the center of the cluster.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: level
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: The severity level for console logging. Default is error.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: rollingFrequency
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: Set frequency for creating a new log file. Default is 1 week. Measured in seconds.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: maximumNumberOfLogFiles
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: Set maximum number of log files stored to optimize storage. Each file contains logs per time specified in rollingFrequency. Default is 4.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: exportLogs(notifyOnQueue:completion:)
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: Export logs file to send for debugging. File is generated in a background thread and completion block is called on notifyOnQueue thread.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: exportedLogs()
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: Export logs file to send for debugging. This method executes synchronously, blocking the current thread until finished generating logs file.

Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C12h3H.name: h3HexToCoord(_:)
Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C12h3H.abstract: Determines the spherical coordinates of the center point of an H3 index.

Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C5vert.name: verts(forH3Hex:)
Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C5vert.abstract: Determines the vertices spherical coordinates of an H3 index.

Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C21cir.name: circleCenterAndRadius(fromH3Hex:)
Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C21cir.abstract: Determines the spherical coordinates of the center point and radius for the circle based on an H3 index.

Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C5h3He.name: h3Hex(coord:)
Classes/H3.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK2H3C5h3He.abstract: Determine H3 index from the spherical coordinates.

Classes/Logger.html.name: Logger
Classes/Logger.html.abstract: Logger that logs network, errors, warnings and other info that can be used to debug.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html.name: TurbulenceCluster
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html.abstract: Turbulence cluster. Generated cluster exists until no turbulence that can be added to this cluster. Cluster is dynamically updated.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html.name: TurbulenceClusterer
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html.abstract: Group TurbulenceItem based on distance. New turbulence will be added to existing clusters or to new clusters.
